Summary Jim Blakley is the general manager of visual cloud solutions at Intel Corporation. In this role, he is responsible for Intel’s data center solutions for video delivery, speech recognition, virtual desktop infrastructure, cloud gaming and visual understanding. His team works with cloud service providers and their suppliers to define, integrate and drive early adoption of leading edge visual cloud solutions. He also works with Intel data center product planning teams to assure that future Intel products meet the needs of cloud technology users. 
 
Mr. Blakley has over 30 years of experience in the computing and communications industries. For the last 14 years, he’s worked at Intel with data center operators and service providers on a wide variety of systems, solutions, strategies and technologies. Jim joined Intel from Lucent Technologies where he was network solution director in the data center and telco practice. At Lucent, he held a variety of R&D, marketing and sales roles. Mr. Blakley was a Distinguished Member of Technical Staff at AT&T Bell Laboratories and one of the original architects and developers of the Advanced Intelligent Network. He began his career at AT&T Bell Laboratories developing hardware, software, firmware and systems for speech technology. 
 
Mr. Blakley holds 4 patents for telecommunications systems and services and is the author of numerous publications. He holds a Masters in Management from the Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University, a Masters of Communication, Information and Control Engineering from the University of Michigan and a BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering also from the University of Michigan. He is a Senior Member of the IEEE. He is a former member of the adjunct faculty at the Oregon Health and Sciences University where he taught business strategy. 
 
Specialties: Visual Computing, Media Delivery, Cloud Computing, Virtualization, Data Networking, Voice Communications, VoIP, Unified Communications. Summary Technology Executive 
 
Dean A. Trumbull is an accomplished senior executive, software architect, and US patent holder with extensive business experience in Managed Security Services, Network Security, Telecom, Computer, and Call Center industries. Dean has spent the past 11 years driving business and product strategy for Global DataGuard Inc., a pioneer in network behavioral analysis and unified enterprise security. Before joining Global DataGuard in February 2004, Dean served as a Division General Manager for Intel Corporation (1999-2003) developing standards-based hardware and software technology for the telecommunication industry. Prior to that, he served as Vice President and Business Unit Manager at Dialogic Corporation (1997-1999) developing computer telephony components.  
Dean began his career in 1981 at National Data Communications (NDC) developing real-time operating systems. In 1983, Dean joined Datapoint Corporation as part of the team developing the ISX digital PBX later sold to Teknekron Infoswitch. Dean spent the next 11 years at Intecom (Dallas) designing software and systemic architectures for the telecommunications industry, and helped pioneer Voice over IP (VoIP) switching technology later sold to Cisco Systems. Later, Dean was part of a successful IPO at Melita International/eShare (Atlanta) as Vice President of Engineering (1994-1997) where he evangelized open systems architectures for telecommunications, developed the first commercially available Voice over ATM computer telephony card, and was awarded US patent 6,118,763 for transmission of voice over an asynchronous network.  
 
 
Specialties: Strategic planning, business analysis, managed security services, network security, product development, software engineering, software architecture, communications technology, telecommunications. Summary Technology Executive
